p: Food type, handwashing station in preparation area, sharing eating containers with family members, and owning animals were associated with higher pathogen diversity at p < 0.3 in bivariate analysis and were considered in the multivariable model ( Table 5). Food type was the only variable retained in the final model for explaining pathogen diversity. Pathogen diversity was 2.35 times higher in milk than in porridge, whereas non-milk/porridge foods trended towards lower levels of diversity.
